Speaker (Male): "Ah, yeah. I remember that. We'd snuggle up and watch old movies all day. Those were the best winters."

Partner (Female): "I know, I do too. It's funny how certain smells and temperatures can transport us back to a specific time and place."

A scream in the silence
Eleven o'clock, a ticking time bomb
A moment lost, a second's delay
The world holds its breath
As the hands move forward
A cry in the darkness
A desperate plea
The clock's cold face
A countdown to chaos
The weight of time
A heavy heart
A racing pulse
The moment slips away
Like sand between fingers
Lost, forgotten, gone
The clock's stern voice
A reminder of the past
A warning of the future
A never-ending cycle
Of urgency and worry
A never-ending refrain
Of "it's 11 o'clock"
